content.description: Hop up using a foot dish and press then friction your way up and left.
content.location: On Split End Rock facing the parking lot

content.description: Starts from small edges at the lip of the intial scoop where tricky footwork up the steep slab gains larger but sloping holds up and left. Getting your feet established over the lip is the crux after which it's fairly easy to the top. Head left over the top of the crack and then back to descend.
content.location:
Just right of

Knuckle Cracker

up a scooped face.

content.description: Thin jams down low lead into a pod which pinches down again just below the top. Not too bad if jamming skills are utilized and about 5.9 or so in difficulty. To descend head straight back and then right.
content.location:
Between the

Augie Problem

and

The Reider Problem

.

content.description: This lengthy traverse follows an undulating undercling flake that passes a few thin spots along the way. Although it can be done in either direction it makes more sense going right to left as you are underclinging up instead of down. A spot is helpful at the finish if going R-L as you downclimb the corner system.
content.protection: pad, perhaps a spotter for a few sections
content.location:
Traverses from the base of

Lower Right Ski Track

, an obvious slanting crack system, to just left of the

Augie Problem

following undercling flakes.

content.description: Start on a side-pull flake and straight up to sloped ledge and then top out.
content.location: This route faces West and is to the right of Split End Left on Split End Rock.

content.description: Start up an arete and then follow scoops up the tall face to an easy topout. Head straight back and then right to descend.
content.location:
About 10' right of the

Intersection Traverse

's right end up a scooped face.
